intro: Hieracium subramosum subsp. pseudorarium, commonly known as the false goat's beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a single head. The leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture and a distinctive lobed shape. This subspecies is native to southern Europe and is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a relatively small plant, typically growing to a height of 10–30 centimeters.
